description.narrative: The project development objective is to establish and support an effective and adaptive safety net system that will increase access of poor and vulnerable people to cash transfer and cash for work programs.

participating-org.narrative: Cellule Filets Sociaux, Cabinet du Premier Ministre

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.3.(B) | Description :Recruitment of a cash transfer manager, cash for work manager,accompanying measures manager, internal auditor, and monitoring and evaluation officer. | Due Date :12-Jan-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.A.2(a) | Description :Independent assessment of the first phase of the cash transferprogram (Subcomponent 2.1). | Due Date :31-Dec-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.A.2(b) | Description :Recruitment of an independent auditor for the assessment of thefirst phase of the cash transfer program. | Due Date :30-Nov-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.B.4 | Description :Recruitment of the independent financial management auditor. | DueDate :15-Dec-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1(a) | Description :Retroactive financing up to an amount not to exceed SDR 650,000 forpayments made on or after January 1, 2011. | Due Date :31-Aug-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1(b) | Description :Recruitment of a targeting firm and completion of targeting ofbeneficiaries; and entering into a contractual agreement with a payment agency satisfactory in substance and form to the Bank. |Due Date :12-Apr-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1(c) | Description :The Recipient has started disbursing under Category 2 and hascarried out the independent assessment demonstrating that the outcomeis globally satisfactory and issues, if any, have beenremedied | Due Date :31-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Recipient has (i) established or designated an account in CFA Francs (the"Project Account), in a bank acceptable to the Association, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association; | Due Date:12-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Recipient has prepared and adopted the Project Implementation Manual and theManual of Administrative, Financial and AccountingProcedures, each in form and substance satisfactory to the Asso | Due Date:12-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Recipient has provided CFS with the resources and capacities described inSchedule 3 to the Appraisal mission's Aide memoire signed between the Recipient and the Association on March 18, 2011 | Due Date:12-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Recipient has recruited a coordinator, an administrative and financial officerand a procurement officer, each selected on the basis of terms of reference, qualifications and experience | Due Date :12-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :This will be integrated with the annual external audit excercise | Description :Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section II.B.5 | Description :Recurrent audit of payment system throughout the implementation of the Project. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :This will be integrated with the annual external audit excercise | Description :Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section II.B.6 | Description :Recruitment of an Independent Technical Auditor for recurrent audit of the payment system. | Due Date:01-Mar-2013

title.narrative: Percentage of villages receiving payments based on the frequency specified in the implementation manual
Registered families who are receiving the transfers
Number of days of work created for women
Households with access to the cash transfer system established by the Project
Number of days of work created for men
Days of temporary employment (broken down by gender)
Beneficiary households that have been identified and registered to receive monthly transfers for a 24-month period
Households participating in the accompanying measures (participation rate)
Project management expenses ratio is inferior or equal to 10%
A Grievance Redress Mechanisms is in place in all communities targeted
A management information system is developed
The impact evaluation is generating lessons
Households with access to the cash for work programs
Cash for work and DRF cash transfer beneficiaries in departments identified as vulnerable by the DN
Micro-projects that are functional at the end of each calendar year
The Government legally identifies the institutional anchorage of the national database
The institution identified to manage the database is functional
Households receiving scaled up cash transfer assistance through the disaster risk financing mechanism
A common database is functional and shared with at least 3 partners
Effectiveness of national SP systems to address Climate Adaptation and Disaster Risk Management
Capacity of Niger’s social protection systems to implement adaptive social protection programs
The monitoring and evaluation mechanism of the DNPGCCA is fully operational and processing the data of all the units of the DNPGCCA.
